review: I first played Pop Cap games when I used my grandparents' computers, and I have enjoyed those games from back in the day, and Bejeweled is no exception! It is one of the first match-3 games ever made, and the jewels from that game were iconic. Even today, if I were to choose between this game and Candy Crush Saga, I would totally pick this game, and I would even come back to it once in a while! Too bad Pop Cap doesn't make original games anymore.

Certainement l'un des p√®res fondateurs qui a popularis√© le genre, Bejeweled Deluxe propose une exp√©rience Match3 color√©e et relaxante √† destination des joueurs occasionnels comme des adeptes de high score. Ici, rien de tr√®s compliqu√© √† comprendre : il suffit d'aligner au minimum trois joyaux de la m√™me couleur ou formes pour ceux qui ont du mal √† discerner les nuances. Le principe, tr√®s simple et compr√©hensible par tous, se montre redoutable de satisfaction d√®s lors que l‚Äôon encha√Æne les associations. Ce jeu en particulier √† son identit√© propre, que cela soit sur l‚Äôaspect visuel ou la dimension musicale. Encore peu √©volu√© dans son approche, et hormis un petit avantage de score lors des combos et des associations sup√©rieures √† trois joyaux,  il n‚Äôy a pas de bonus. Deux modes de jeu sont pr√©sents. Les parties en mode ¬´¬†normal¬†¬ª sont relaxantes et vous laisseront le temps de d√©cider judicieusement quel joyau d√©placer en vue d‚Äôanticiper un combo. Quant au mode de jeu ¬´¬†Timetrial¬†¬ª il s‚Äôagira d‚Äôassocier les joyaux le plus rapidement possible avant que la barre de temps ne se vide. Chaque association ou combo vous accordera un gain de temps. Dans l‚Äôensemble, et surtout de nos jours, ces diff√©rents modes peuvent para√Ætre basiques cependant ils sont suffisant pour vous occuper de nombreuses heures. Le soft est peu adapt√© aux configurations modernes mais cela n‚Äôemp√™che pas son lancement, un remaster serait sans doute le bienvenu¬†! Cependant, j‚Äôimagine que seuls les joueurs nostalgiques des jeux flash s‚Äôattardent encore sur ce titre.

There was a time we'd all be playing games in our web browsers.
I was introduced the Lycos variant of then-called Diamond Mine.
Since 2002, this game series has been one of my most-played.
Yes, the game is very basic, but the demoscene music pulled me in.
In the end, it put me in the PopCap craze throughout the noughts and teens.

Pretty basic match three puzzle game.
You should play this at least once, to see how the sequel improved upon the game play.
Recommended because I remember staying up until stupid o'clock trying to beat my score/next level.

[i]No issues running this on Windows 11[/i]

At first the game seemed pointless and I didn't like it. Then I realized that there was a logic behind the moves, and that made it fun enough to play for more hours than I like to count. If you like relaxing puzzles, try it, it's addictive.
SQUAD B FOR FUCKS SAKE STOP PLAYING BEJEWELED
Bejeweled is very fun!

It is Bejeweled in its most basic form. There are no bombs or power-ups of any kind, and there are just two game modes: Normal and Timetrial. And yet, the game is still as addicting as some of the later entries in the series. And the music for Timetrial Mode goes unreasonably hard. I love it.
It's alright
Classic, simple, but still fun

The one that started it all! Very bare bones match 3 game, especially by today's standards. But definitely worth getting as a cart-filler. Scratches that simplistic "I need something to pass the time" itch perfectly and runs on literally anything you throw at it. Absolute classic.
It's ok.
Cant really go wrong with Bejeweled. Dead simple yet addicting gameplay with a banger soundtrack, what more could you really want?

the one that started it all. pretty basic compared to later entries and other games, only endless/random matching, but it still does what it sets out to do and worth it for the soundtrack alone (composed by peter hajba, aka skaven/future crew). then again, there's a demo, not to mention youtube, so you can listen to the music for free.

"Are you ready for your game design lessons?"
"Yes, Bejeweled Deluxe." We say in unison.
One of the first fathers of the "Match 3" genre, it's a classic.

God this game is so fucking good. I just wanna match jewels for hours. How did popcap games make a game as amazing as this. I think i'll name my first child bejeweled. Heck, I'll name name my second bejeweled too

It's fine, but there's no reason to play this one when 2, Twist, and 3 are also on Steam. This was originally a web game and it shows. The music is also insufferable.

Cool only for the novelty, but your brain will melt if you actually want to play some Bejeweled.

Before you decide to play Vampire: The Masquerade Bloodlines, it is highly recommended to install either the Unofficial Patch or the Clan Quest Mod. The Clan Quest Mod is a great choice if you want additional content that was never part of the base game, while the Unofficial Patch focuses more on restoring cut content from the original developers and fixing a large number of bugs.

Now, onto the game itself:
I‚Äôm writing this review mainly because Vampire: The Masquerade Bloodlines 2 is on the horizon, and this year I revisited the first game. The World of Darkness (WoD) universe is incredibly well developed and expands far beyond video games, including pen-and-paper RPGs similar to Dungeons and Dragons and even visual novels. Once you get a taste of the first Bloodlines, despite the wear and tear of time, you‚Äôll almost certainly be drawn deeper into the World of Darkness. The WoD setting includes not only vampires, but also werewolves, witches, and magic, all tied together with a rich hierarchy system and layers of alternate history. Vampire: The Masquerade Bloodlines stays true to this world with remarkable authenticity, offering players the chance to join iconic clans, make impactful choices, and experience dynamic combat.

For me personally, Bloodlines holds a special place in my heart. As a child, I first encountered the game‚Äôs cover art, played it briefly, but didn‚Äôt fully understand it. Years later, about six years ago, I gave it another try... and that‚Äôs when I truly fell in love. I immersed myself in the lore and characters, finally grasped the intricacies of the Masquerade system, and from then on I became fully invested in the World of Darkness universe. Despite its technical shortcomings, I strongly recommend patience and tolerance toward its outdated mechanics. Bloodlines is a flawed masterpiece, but one that rewards players with unforgettable storytelling, atmosphere, and immersion into the dark, haunting world of vampires.

aside from the many game breaking bugs this game has, it's one of the greatest rpgs ever made. the atmosphere is phenomenal and all the characters and clans and levels are memorable and full of life. i recommend new players to install the unofficial patch as it fixes many of the bugs of this rough gem and even brings back some cool cut and unused features and tracks!. 10/10 gem.

This game is really solid, even though it suffers from many bugs. Despite all its problems and flaws, I had a really good time with it.
The gameplay may be a bit funky, but it's tight. The music is excellent and the dialogue is especially genious. All in all, the whole game is dripping with atmosphere.

Highly recommend it if you're a RPG fan and haven't tried it yet.

My late adolescence years spent playing this game.
No wonder why I still love this masterpiece.
Amusing and intriguing storyline, beautifully designed world and characters (for the time), plenty of choices and customisation of your character.
It is undoubtedly the true pioneer of the Vampire RPG genre. No competitors nor equals to me.

I can't wait for the second instalment to be released soon, though I doubt it will equate the original magic and sparkles created by this pearl.
Damn I can‚Äôt believe they translated the vibes of Gregg Araki‚Äôs Apocalypse Trilogy into video game form. Coulda been gayer and extremely jank but what‚Äôs here kicks so much ass.
There are some silly moments, but this game can be very fun in various ways! Can't wait for Bloodlines 2
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines: The best game ever

Excelente jogo, embora caro para a √©poca em que foi lan√ßado. Basta instalar o patch da comunidade e roda sem bugs, inclusive foi o jogo mais f√°cil que eu modifiquei at√© agora. Por√©m tive que desinstalar devido a uma s√©rie de conflitos com o antivirus, que desapareceu com o arquivo .exe sem nem botar em quarentena faltando provavelmente apenas 2 miss√µes...
install the unofficial patch.

If a game still feels fresh more than twenty years after its release there's a good reason for that. Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines has more than one.

Most of all it's because of the story, the way it's told and the way the player deals with it. The game has one of the best writings ever. It draws you into its storyline and the world it takes place in. The vampire setting may seem like a space for pulp fiction, but playing will convince you that there's nothing more natural than playing as a vampire in jeans, running around Los Angeles at night. Vampire Clans differ not only in appearance but also in their abilities and behavior. Each significant character has their own personality and acts according to specific motives that are readable for the player and you can decide for yourself whose side you will be on. Throughout each quests you feel like you're part of something really cool. There is a vibrant plot behind most of them. You won't encounter anything like killing rats or similar banalities just to get XP.

I don't want to say that everything is perfect. For me there's no point in complaining about the graphics. And the reason is not the age. Even in 2004 it wasn't on the same level as Half-Life 2, with which the game shares Source engine and the time of its release. The graphics are clearly a bit better in Valve's work. But anyway, yet even today I find it dignified.
What's actually sucks is the combat system. It's frustrating because of the futility of the process. Considering that you have poor combat skills at the beginning of the game the enemies have an unnecessarily large advantage over you. You often just punch into the air and hope to hit the target. Situations where the enemy is defeated by a knife rather than a firearm are the rule. This is no joke, unfortunately. Yes, you can improve your combat skills as you progress through the game. But even after half the game, the fights are not worth much. Was it a mistake that the creators chose real-time battles instead of turn-based?

Still, despite all my criticisms, I will calmly include it on the list of the best games I've ever played. Sure, elements I value most in video games is abundantly fulfilled here. For anyone else it's worth trying. Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines is a unique experience even in 2025.

My favorite winter game. I love this game and can't wait to play Bloodlines 2. Buy this game, mod this game, and bring vampire happiness into your unlives. Welcome into the World of Darkness children of the night.

Alpha Prime is like a mix of Halo, Half-Life and DooM 3 vibes. Its fun but sometimes the AI is just...too good or completely careless, no in between that, the IA will focus fire on you and you will be dead in an instant or they will just suicide attack you carelessly and you kill them quickly. The story is kinda fun but pretty bland (except for Paolo, best character in the game).  The guns are nice...though after mission 6, I didnt find any pistol ammo so you will rely on the good ol shotgun or rifle. 

So...do I recommend Alpha Prime...errr....yes and no (at least if its on discount and want to wait some time buy it). 

I give it a 7.5/1.0.

A janky, misguided mess, Alpha Prime is flawed down to its hubbardium-ridden DNA. It's a capital F failure and a caps-locked SLAVJANK. 

And it's art, as fascinating as a train crash and just as difficult to pull your eyes away from.

I believe in Glomar, and you will too.

[h1]
FPS set in distant space. Play as Arnold and terminate evil robots and stoned workers - not bad for a shooter. Levels are interesting enough to play. What to expect? Wonky humor, alien robots, cool weapons and decent shooting. Lean behind the corners for extra advantage and element of surprise. Visuals are ok for a game from 2000s. Soundtrack is good and will immerse you into gameplay. Recommended for FPS enthusiasts.
[/h1]

Even as a product of its time, it's not a good game. The AI is either incredibly obtuse or takes 2 head shots with a sniper rifle to kill, there is no in between. the guns have no feel to them when shooting. The shotgun is useless, even a point blank shot to the back of the heat didn't kill in one hit. Even though you can walk, and be MUCH faster, the game insists on forcing you to take a tram the entire level. Pointless. It doesn't build tension, there is no tension, its just you waiting. The things you can hack are situational and provide a marginal if any difference. Would not recommend.
